docs.snippet: MOSCOW, July 24. -- It seems only yesterday that ordinary Soviet citizens, even of undoubted loyalty to the regime, could not hide a certain apologetic enviousness when discussing Soviet accomplishments in relation to similar accomplishments in the...
docs.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, July 24. -- It seems only yesterday that ordinary Soviet citizens, even of undoubted loyalty to the regime, could not hide a certain apologetic enviousness when discussing Soviet accomplishments in relation to similar accomplishments in the Western World.

headline.main: RUSSIAN LANGUAGE EXALTED BY SOVIET; Pressure Put on Scientists to Use Native Tongue and Drop 'Servility' to the West.

byline.original: By HAROLD DENNYSpecial Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BERLIN, July 25. -- With a lavishness and panoply of ceremony no other Olympics in history have had, the eleventh modern Olympic Games will start in the magnificent stadium here Saturday when the ringing tones of Chancellor Hitler boom forth the news...
docs.lead_paragraph: BERLIN, July 25. -- With a lavishness and panoply of ceremony no other Olympics in history have had, the eleventh modern Olympic Games will start in the magnificent stadium here Saturday when the ringing tones of Chancellor Hitler boom forth the news in one simple sentence that the meet is formally declared open.

headline.main: U.S. Is Favored to Gain Major Honors in Berlin Olympics Opening Saturday; GREAT SPORT PLANT PROVIDED BY REICH Olympic Games, to Be Opened Saturday by Hitler, Will Have Magnificent Setting. 6,800 LISTED TO COMPETE Previous Record Was 4,000 -Americans Picked to Head the Victory Parade.

byline.original: By ARTHUR J. DALEYWireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: The Spanish rebellion had a depressing effect upon the foreign exchange market last week. While the reaction was moderate, it was obvious that bankers and dealers were cutting their demands to routine requirements, meanwhile adopting an attitude of...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Spanish rebellion had a depressing effect upon the foreign exchange market last week. While the reaction was moderate, it was obvious that bankers and dealers were cutting their demands to routine requirements, meanwhile adopting an attitude of caution pending solution of the disturbances.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED JULY 25, 1936

docs.snippet: A total of $929,000 Republic of Cuba 5 per cent bonds of 1904 have been drawn for redemption at par on Sept. 1, 1936, Speyer  Co., fiscal agents, have announced. In addition, the firm has bought in the market for cancellation through the sinking...
docs.lead_paragraph: A total of $929,000 Republic of Cuba 5 per cent bonds of 1904 have been drawn for redemption at par on Sept. 1, 1936, Speyer Co., fiscal agents, have announced. In addition, the firm has bought in the market for cancellation through the sinking fund, $107,000 of the bonds.

headline.main: 300 REBELS HELD ON SHIP; 1,800 Buildings In Catalonia Taken Over by Government.

docs.snippet: MADRID, July 30. (Passed by the censor) -- The government decreed today the confiscation of the entire Spanish merchant marine, which includes lines operating between Spanish and North American and South American ports. The ships will be placed at...
docs.lead_paragraph: MADRID, July 30. (Passed by the censor) -- The government decreed today the confiscation of the entire Spanish merchant marine, which includes lines operating between Spanish and North American and South American ports. The ships will be placed at the disposal of the navy for the duration of the revolt.
docs.abstract: reptd under guard on liner, Uruguay

headline.main: MERCHANT MARINE SEIZED BY MADRID; Navy Will Use Ships to Combat Rebels -- Shop Girls Enlisted to Defend the Capital. WAY TO PORTUGAL OPENED Four Submarines Are in Hands of Fascists, Decree Reveals -- Disloyal Officials Ousted. MERCHANT MARINE SEIZED BY MADRID

byline.original: By WILLIAM P. CARNEYWireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BARCELONA, Spain, Aug. 1. -- A loyal column from here has put to flight enemy cavalry and captured Sastago and Quinto, towns forty and thirty miles, respectively, from Saragossa. Aircraft cooperated in the operations.
docs.lead_paragraph: BARCELONA, Spain, Aug. 1. -- A loyal column from here has put to flight enemy cavalry and captured Sastago and Quinto, towns forty and thirty miles, respectively, from Saragossa. Aircraft cooperated in the operations.

byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: The crisis in Spain continued to dominate unfavorably the course of foreign exchanges last week. The possibility that there might be an extension of the area of hostilities was not overlooked and much apprehension prevailed in banking quarters on...
docs.lead_paragraph: The crisis in Spain continued to dominate unfavorably the course of foreign exchanges last week. The possibility that there might be an extension of the area of hostilities was not overlooked and much apprehension prevailed in banking quarters on this score.

docs.snippet: PARIS, Aug. 4. -- To the French Government's suggestion for collective neutrality among the Mediterranean powers in the Spanish civil war the British Government replied today in a note that is being described as broadly affirmative and cordial and as...
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Aug. 4. -- To the French Government's suggestion for collective neutrality among the Mediterranean powers in the Spanish civil war the British Government replied today in a note that is being described as broadly affirmative and cordial and as containing some new suggestions.

headline.main: BRITAIN ENDORSES NEUTRALITY PLEA; Agrees to French Hands-Off Proposal on Condition That Italy Also Accepts. ROME'S REPLY IS DELAYED Germany Is Willing to Discuss Non-Intervention in Spain if Soviet Is Bound.
